Hence also he deservedly obtained an illustrious name in the Church of God, because he moreover helped the apos- tles in preaching: for Eusebius, lib. ii. cap. 16, writes, that the churches through all Egypt were founded chiefly by his labour. Dorotheus iu his Synopsis relates‚ that he was first Bishop of Alexandria, and was there honoured with the crown of martyrdom under Trajan. Jerome also, in his Catalogue of Ecclesiastical writers, states that he was buried in the same city.
